Com_Photo_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>Ah, how I'd love to put <clr:0000>a panoramic
picture of Floria Falls in that frame<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0000>A view from the bridge outside, with the
towering waterfalls of Floria Falls all
around you...
That's the kind of stunning vista that can
only be found in Faron.

<sp:3:0:2:0800>Yes. If I'm to hang something here,
a picture of <clr:0000>Floria Falls<clr:ffff> on <clr:0000>a clear day<clr:ffff>
would be best.
It would really draw in customers, don't
you think?

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>But between the rainfall and all my work
here, I don't know when I'll be able to
paint something like that.
Com_Photo_Thank:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Thanks to you, Link, a ray of light shines
in my storm-battered stable.

Visitors to Faron may not find clear skies
outside, but in here, the mood will always
be bright and sunny!
Com_Photo_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Huh? Did you bring me <clr:0000>a picture of
Floria Falls on a clear day<clr:ffff>?!
BurnedWakka_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>If you're that interested in ring garlands,
why not go and get one yourself?

They sell them at a place called
<clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>, up in Necluda!
Com_Photo_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0301>It's bad form to have a picture frame
hanging there, all sad and empty.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>If only I had <clr:0000>a picture of Floria Falls on a
clear day<clr:ffff>, I'd copy it as fast as I could and
put it up there.
DoNotWakka_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>That's a protective charm of sorts that
has become rather popular lately.

I hear it's based on the Ring Ruins that
fell in <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>.

You been to <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>? It's up
north in Necluda.

Nice place. Definitely worth a visit.
Com_Photo_06:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Do you happen to have <clr:0000>a picture of
Floria Falls on a clear day<clr:ffff>?
DoNotWakka_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_01>Excuse me, but that flower decoration
is for display only.

If you want one, you'll have to make
your way to <clr:0000>Kakariko Village <clr:ffff>in Necluda
up north.
And while you're there, you can take a
gander at the Ring Ruins. I hear they're a
sight to behold!
Com_Photo_07:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>Stunning, isn't it?


That said, if you ever want me to hang
a different <clr:0000>picture of Floria Falls on a
clear day<clr:ffff>, I'll be happy to oblige.
Just show me the new picture. I'll paint
up a copy and display it instead!
Com_Photo_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Ah, the falls really pack a punch.
No matter how many times I see them,
I'm always moved beyond words.
That picture will make travelers glad they
made the long, slippery trip to Faron!
Com_Photo_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><clr:0000>A picture of Floria Falls on a clear day...<clr:ffff>
If such a piece of art existed, it would be
perfect for my stable.
Com_Photo_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Whenever I look at that picture, I get
excited all over again.
Talk_0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Is this your first time in the area, sir?<sp:0:4:0>It's a little-known fact that our stable
receives orders from <clr:0000>Princess Zelda<clr:ffff>
herself.
At her direction, we opened a sanctuary
for a <clr:0000>new animal species<clr:ffff>. It's <clr:0000>right across
the ravine<clr:ffff> from here.
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy>Ordinary visitors can't easily reach it,
but with a telescope or the like, you
might be able to snatch a glimpse.
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Anyway, once again...
Talk_0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The rain is almost constant here, but once
in a while, it does let up. Like now.

When it's raining, the well behind the
stable is too full for me to go inside.

But when the skies are calm like this,
the water in the well disappears and
I can give it a good scrub.
Come to think of it, I should probably go
and do that now...

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_00>Take care not to slip!
Com_Photo_12:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Anyway!<sp:5:0:0> Did you want to do something
with my beloved <clr:0000>picture of Floria Falls on
a clear day<clr:ffff>?
Com_FirstTime_Only01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>And now, since this is your first time
with us at <clr:0000>Lakeside Stable<clr:ffff>...
Talk_0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The rain is almost constant here, but once
in a while, it does let up.

When it's raining, the well behind the
stable is too full for me to go inside.

But when the skies are calm, the water
in the well disappears and I can give it
a good scrub.
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Think_01>As for when the rains might die down
next... That's anyone's guess.
Com_FirstTime_Only02:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Now! You used <clr:0000>Lakeside Stable <clr:ffff>for the
first time and also <clr:0000>registered a horse<clr:ffff>,
which means...
Com_Photo_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I spent a while mulling over what painting
could be worthy of such a nice frame.
Here's my thought.
When it's clear out—<sp:5:0:0>which, granted, isn't
often around these parts—<sp:5:0:0>you can get a
beautiful view of Floria Falls.
The best place to see it is <clr:0000>Floria Bridge<clr:ffff>
outside the stable. <sp:5:0:0>Wouldn't the view from
there make a nice painting?
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Problem is, I can't leave the stable
unattended, and even if I could, it's rare
that the weather is clear enough.
But maybe there's some other way to
get <clr:0000>a panoramic view of Floria Falls on a
clear day<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>If someone brought me a <clr:0000>picture<clr:ffff>, for
instance, then I'd be able to paint a
copy and hang that up in the frame.
Com_FirstTime_Only03:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Now! You used <clr:0000>Lakeside Stable <clr:ffff>for
the first time and also <clr:0000>lodged with us<clr:ffff>,
which means...
Com_Photo_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Huh? Do you have <clr:0000>a picture of Floria Falls
on a clear day<clr:ffff>?
